thread.title: Doorman dies in freak accident after falling through glass window and slashing throat while shovelling snow
thread.title_full: Doorman dies in freak accident after falling through glass window and slashing throat while shovelling snow

author: Natalie Evans
title: Doorman dies in freak accident after falling through glass window and slashing throat while shovelling snow
text:
News Doorman dies in freak accident after falling through glass window and slashing throat while shovelling snow Miguel Gonzalez, 59, suffered severe lacerations to his neck after he slipped and fell while clearing snow from the steps of his building Share Miguel Gonzalez with wife Elena Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A doorman died in a gruesome freak accident after slipping and falling through a glass window while shovelling snow. 
Miguel Gonzalez, 59, lost his footing while clearing the steps outside his building in New York's Upper East side on Thursday morning. 
He slipped and fell through a plate glass window, slashing his throat, police said. 
Authorities confirmed Gonzalez, from Bridgeport, Connecticut, suffered "severe lacerations" to his neck and was pronounced dead in hospital. Read More Woman found dead in recycling bin 'was removing clothes when footstool collapsed leaving her dangling from broken arm' 
Denise Rich, a resident of the building on E93rd Street, paid tribute to the man known as 'Uncle Mickey'. 
She told NECN.com: "He always had a big smile and a big hello. Very positive, wonderful...just a happy soul. This was very tragic." The freak accident happened at Gonzalez's building on E93rd Street 
Gonzalez's widow Elena told the website: "He was such a great man. Very humble. Hard worker. 
"Good with the family, he always was the supporter of the whole family in Puerto Rico." 
Gonzalez was planning to retire to his native Puerto Rico in the next two years. Read More Dad who died in freak accident saves THREE lives after his family donate his organs 
Hector Figueroa, president of Local 32BJ of the Service Employees International Union, paid tribute to Gonzalez, who had worked for the same company for 33 years. 
"Our thoughts and prayers also go out to all members working hard to keep us safe during this blizzard and every day." 
A solidarity fund has been set up for the Gonzalez family here . Like us on Facebook
